definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This leads to sagging skin, loss of firmness and the appearance of wrinkles.
sentences.chinese: 这会导致皮肤松弛，失去的坚定性和皱纹的出现。

sentences.english: And than we should interference steadfastness of principle in U. S. A. combine with flexibility of the tactics.
sentences.chinese: 其次是应对美国原则的坚定性与策略的灵活性相结合。

sentences.english: Of course, we know what’s motivating Mr. Romney’s sudden lack of conviction.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们知道罗姆尼先生突然间坚定性缺失的原因。

sentences.english: Statesmen prize steadiness and reliability in a partner .
sentences.chinese: 政治家很重视一个伙伴的坚定性和可靠性。

sentences.english: Function: Strengthens skin elasticity and firmness of double cheek.
sentences.chinese: 增强皮肤弹性和坚定性双重脸颊。

sentences.english: She showed steadiness and courage in the pursuit of her aims.
sentences.chinese: 她在追求自己的目标时表现出坚定性与勇气。

sentences.english: He expressed his thoughts with customary firmness and logic .
sentences.chinese: 他以一贯的坚定性和逻辑性谈了他的看法。

sentences.english: Unity of the flexibility of steadfastness and tactics of adhering to principles.
sentences.chinese: 把握原则的坚定性与策略的灵活性的统一。

definition: the spirit or character of a political party
the mass line, CCP term for Party policy aimed at broadening and cultivating contacts with the masses

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 te4 se4 she4 hui4 zhu3 yi4

definition: to translate sth into action/to put sth into action
